phrases:
-
Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters "-" and "0" - "9" ). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is "99999" while negative int is "-99999"). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. "00023" = "23").
Examples:
723 in field 21 would be mapped int as |21=723|.
-723 in field 12 would be mapped int as |12=-723|
The following data types are based on int.
Sequence of digits with optional decimal point and sign character (ASCII characters "-", "0" - "9" and "."); the absence of the decimal point within the string will be interpreted as the float representation of an integer value. All float fields must accommodate up to fifteen significant digits.
Alpha-numeric free format strings, can include any character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive.
Time/date combination in YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS format, colons and dash required. Valid values: YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-59.
Date in YYYYMMDD format. Valid values: YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31.
Raw data with no format or content restrictions. Data fields are always immediately preceded by a length field. Caution: may contain the delimiter (SOH) character.
Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.
Unique identifier of advertisement message
Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE transaction types.
Broker's side of advertised trade
Buy
Sell
Trade
Cross
Identifies advertisement message transaction type
Cancel
New
Replace
Calculated average price of all fills on this order.
Message sequence number of first record in range to be resent
Identifies beginning of new message and protocol version. ALWAYS FIRST FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted)
Message length, in bytes, forward to the CheckSum field. ALWAYS SECOND FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted)
Three byte, simple checksum (see Appendix B for description). ALWAYS LAST FIELD IN RECORD; i.e. serves, with the trailing <SOH>, as the end-of-record delimiter. Always defined as three characters. (Always unencrypted)
Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

per share
percentage
absolute

(0 - 1000000000)
Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.
Message sequence number of last record in range to be resent. If request is for a single record BeginSeqNo = EndSeqNo. If request is for all messages subsequent to a particular message, EndSeqNo = "999999"
Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by broker (will be 0 (zero) for ExecTransType=3 (Status)).
Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID field to assure uniqueness across days.
Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

The Heartbeat monitors the status of the communication link and identifies when the last of a string of messages was not received.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 0
Required when the heartbeat is the result of a Test Request message.
The test request message forces a heartbeat from the opposing application. The test request message checks sequence numbers or verifies communication line status. The opposite application responds to the Test Request with a Heartbeat containing the TestReqID.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 1
The resend request is sent by the receiving application to initiate the retransmission of messages. This function is utilized if a sequence number gap is detected, if the receiving application lost a message, or as a function of the initialization process.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 2
The reject message should be issued when a message is received but cannot be properly processed due to a session-level rule violation. An example of when a reject may be appropriate would be the receipt of a message with invalid basic data which successfully passes de-encryption, CheckSum and BodyLength checks.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 3
MsgSeqNum of rejected message
Where possible, message to explain reason for rejection
The sequence reset message is used by the sending application to reset the incoming sequence number on the opposing side.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 4
The logout message initiates or confirms the termination of a FIX session. Disconnection without the exchange of logout messages should be interpreted as an abnormal condition.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 5
Indication of interest messages are used to market merchandise which the broker is buying or selling in either a proprietary or agency capacity.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 6
Required for Cancel and Replace IOITransType messages
Side of Indication
Valid values:
1 = Buy
2 = Sell
Indication without currency field is interpreted as US dollars.
Applicable only if advertised on public IOI service.
Advertisement messages are used to announce completed transactions.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 7
Required for Cancel and Replace AdvTransType messages
Indication without currency field is interpreted as US dollars.
The execution report message is used to:
1. Confirm the receipt of an order
2. Confirm changes to an existing order (i.e. accept cancel and replace requests)
3. Relay order status information
4. Relay fill information as orders are worked
5. Reject orders
6. Report miscellaneous fees calculations associated with a trade
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = 8
Required for executions against electronically submitted orders which were assigned an ID by the institution. Not required for orders manually entered by the broker.

The allocation record is used to instruct a broker on how to allocate executed shares to sub-accounts. The allocation record can also be used as a confirmation message through which third parties can communicate execution and settlement instructions between trading partners.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = J
Required for AllocTransType = R (Replace) or C (Cancel)
Indicates number of orders to be combined for allocation. If order(s) were manually delivered set to 1 (one).
Order ID assigned by client if order(s) were electronically delivered and executed. If order(s) were manually delivered this field should contain string "MANUAL".
Required for List Orders.
Indicates number of individual execution record groups to follow. Absence of this field indicates that no individual execution records are included.

The list cancel request message type is used by institutions wishing to cancel previously submitted lists either before or during execution.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = K
The list execute message type is used by institutions to instruct the broker to begin execution of a previously submitted list.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = L
Must be unique, by customer, for the day
The list status request message type is used by institutions to instruct the broker to generate status messages for a list.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = M
The list status message is issued as the response to a List Status Request message and indicates the current state of the orders within the list as they exists at the broker's site.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = N
Total number of messages required to status complete list.
Sequence number of this report message.
Number of orders statused in this message, i.e. number of repeating groups to follow.
The allocation ACK record is used by the broker to acknowledge the receipt and status of an allocation record received from the institution.

MsgType = P
Used for firm identification in third-party transactions.

Can include explanation for AllocRejCode = 7 (other)
The Dont Know Trade (DK) message is used to notify a trading partner that an electronically received execution has been rejected. This message can be thought of as an execution reject message.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = Q
Broker Order Id as identified on problem execution
Execution Id of problem execution
In some markets it is the practice to request quotes from brokers prior to placement of an order. The quote request message is used for this purpose.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = R
Useful for verifying security identification
The quote message is used as the response to a quote request message and can be used to publish unsolicited quotes.
BEFORE CALL MSGCOMP_FIELDS_DESCS in gen_i18n FOR MESSAGES
MsgType = S
Required when quote is in response to a Quote Request message
The standard FIX message header
FIX.4.0 (Always unencrypted, must be first field in message)
(Always unencrypted, must be second field in message)
(Always unencrypted, must be third field in message)
(Always unencrypted)
(Always unencrypted)

Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Required to identify length of encrypted section of message. (Always unencrypted)
Required when message body is encrypted. Always immediately follows SecureDataLen field.
(Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
(Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
"ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Always required for retransmissions, whether prompted by the sending system or as the result of a resend request. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Required when message may be duplicate of another message sent under a different sequence number. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
(Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
Required for message resends. If data is not available set to same value as SendingTime (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.)
The standard FIX message trailer

Note: Not to be included within SecureData field
(Always unencrypted, always last field in message)
